description: The `Codebase Interaction Tools` subsystem provides LLM agents with a programmatic interface to interact with and query the codebase. Its boundaries encompass all tools and managers necessary for file system access, static code analysis, and adherence to repository ignore rules. The subsystem exhibits a layered and collaborative structure: `CodeBoardingToolkit` acts as the primary interface and orchestrator, `Analysis Tools` represent the core functionality specializing in codebase interaction, `Base Repository Tooling` provides common infrastructure and context, and `Repository Ignore Manager` enforces file and directory exclusion policies. This structure promotes modularity, allowing new analysis tools to be added easily by extending `Base Repository Tooling` and registering with `CodeBoardingToolkit`, while `Repository Ignore Manager` consistently applies filtering policies across the subsystem.

components.name: CodeBoardingToolkit
components.description: Acts as the central orchestrator and entry point for all code analysis and information retrieval tools within the CodeBoarding subsystem. It aggregates and exposes a suite of specialized tools to external agents or components, facilitating a unified interface for codebase interaction.

components.name: Analysis Tools
components.description: A collection of specialized tools designed to perform various types of code analysis and information extraction. These tools provide granular access to codebase details, including file content, project structure, code references, and static analysis data, acting as the agents' primary interface to the code.

components.name: Base Repository Tooling
components.description: Provides a common base class and shared functionalities for many specialized analysis tools. It encapsulates repository context, manages resources like file/directory caching, and integrates with the ignore manager to ensure consistent and efficient operation across all derived tools.

components.name: Repository Ignore Manager
components.description: Manages and applies `.codeboardingignore` and `.gitignore` rules to filter files and directories. This component ensures that analysis tools operate only on relevant subsets of the codebase, preventing unnecessary processing and respecting developer-defined exclusions.
